revised_title: The Damping of Sound by Frothy Liquids: A Study of the Efficiency of Bubbles in Damping Vibrations
tldr: The author investigates the damping of sound by frothy liquids and discovers that a small quantity of liquid, when distributed as froth, lowers the velocity of sound transmission enormously. The efficiency of bubbles in damping vibrations increases rapidly as their diameter and the distance between them decreases.
